channel.title: INSPIRE Lab @ UCF on INSPIRE Lab @ UCF
channel.description: Recent content in INSPIRE Lab @ UCF on INSPIRE Lab @ UCF

item.title: New funded project on ride-sharing system analysis
item.description: INSPIRE Lab is awarded a project (funding source US DOE) on “Impacts of Electrified Ride-sharing on Transportation and Energy Systems”.

item.title: New publication
item.description: New publication in resale vaule of PEVs on Energy Policy based on large scale online true market value data. Access Link

item.title: Finalists in poster competition
item.description: INSPIRE LAB’s poster on Distribution Network Reconfiguration with Decentralized Autonomous Electric Vehicles was in the finalist (top 6) of the poster competition at the 2018 INFORMS Annual Meeting.

item.title: Residual Value Analysis of Plug-in Vehicles in the United States
Presentation at INFORMS 2018
item.description: Dr. Guo will present his work, collaborating with Sandia National Labs and UC Davis, on evolvement of charging infrastructure in a competitive and stochastic market at INFORMs 2018 in Phoenix.

item.title: Contingency-Constrained Unit Commitment With Intervening Time for System Adjustments
Dynamic Distribution Network Reconfiguration Considering Travel Behaviors and Battery Degradation of Electric Vehicles
A Stochastic Multi-agent Optimization Model for Energy Infrastructure Planning under Uncertainty in An Oligopolistic Market
Agnet-base Simulation for Complext Infratructure Systems
Cascading Failures and Robust Planning/Operation of Power System
Charging Infrastructure Evolvement in a Competitive Market
Kyle Cooke
item.description: As a dedicated worker, Kyle has spent the past five years as an educator, and he is currently perusing a degree in civil engineering. With his prior work experience, he has been able to plan ahead of schedules, manage a diverse range of situations, and solve complex problems. As a forward-thinking professional, he is committed to finding economic solutions to a variety of engineering endeavors.

item.title: Sean Morrisey
item.description: Sean is an undergraduate in Civil Engineering at UCF. He is currently serving at US Navy.
